Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Boise, stop pouting. I told you that hunting whales was more difficult than it sounded.
You say a lot of things that I choose to ignore.
Then you have no one to blame but yourself.
I'm not blaming anyone, and I'm not pouting either! I'm planning my next move.

Fields.MenuText: That doesn't sound good.
Sounds exciting.
Should I even bother asking?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe not to you, but it does to me!
I'm glad you agree, Captain.
Nah, you don't need'a know yet.
As long as you don't break the ship, we should be good.
(smiles)
Don't smile like that...
Oh, that's the alarm. Time to get the fight started!
I have a feeling this is going to hurt.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, can I ask a favor?

Fields.MenuText: Of course, Boise.
No, but I have a feeling you're going to ask anyway.
*groan*

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap.
You would be correct.
You sound like a sick walrus.
I was hoping I could ask some of the crew to pick something up for me the next time we make port.
Why are you asking me? You don't need to ask my permission to ask people things.
Oh, sure. I guess that makes sense. Well, see ya later!
Wait a second, what do you want them to pick up for you?
Is that the alarm I hear? We better go fight some Morganas!
I don't hear anything.
*ALARM*
Well, now I do.
See! Let's go already.
*groan*
@BATTLE
Officer, could I ask you something really fast?
Sure, Captain. What do you need?

Fields.MenuText: Did Boise ask you to get something for her?
What is Boise up to?
Did Boise tell you about the plan?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but... she asked us not to tell you anything.
I'm sorry, Captain, but she asked to keep it secret from you.
Wait, you know about the plan?
Okay, this is ridiculous. Just tell me, I'll deal with Boise.
Fine, just don't tell her I told you. She's going to---
*loud cough* Excuse me, you two. We've got Morganas to our west.
Oh, uh, I'll go get ready!
I'll deal with you later.
EEK!
So you're really intent on not letting me find out?
Yes, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm the Captain. I will figure it out.
Fine, I can wait. I'm not too worried.
Just be careful. I'd hate to have to throw you in the brig.

Fields.DialogueText: You can try. But by the time you do, it'll already be too late.
You shouldn't be. It's not too bad.
Same here. It's always such a hassle to phase my way out of there.
I wasn't kidding about those Morganas, though. Let's go!
@BATTLE
I'm your commanding officer. I can order you to tell me.
Well, I can tell you, but then Boise would probably get angry. I'm pretty sure no one wants that.
Of course, I'm the Captain. I know everything.
I don't think you know this. Boise made it pretty clear she didn't want you hearing about anything.
Well, can you tell me why she wants to keep it a secret?
I wouldn't want to make Boise angry. Would you?
This food is worse than I remember. Maybe it's time to go fishing again.

Fields.MenuText: It's not that bad. I kind of like it.
Yeah, maybe we can get some fishing in soon. I might even join you.
Maybe you can try to catch a whale again.

Fields.DialogueText: Your taste buds died long ago, Captain.
That sounds fun. As long as you don't mind me catching all the fish. You can be my cheerleader.
Hey, I haven't given up yet. It's just not my top priority.
So, maybe next time we make port, we can go fishing?
Sure... wait, next time we make port? That might not work out so well.
Why?
No reason. Just... reasons...
Is this about your little secret plan?
You know this food is really delicious, actually! I can't get enough of it!
Don't talk with your mouth full, Boise. It's gross.
*ALARM*
Oh, there's the alarm. Time to work off all this food!
@BATTLE
Wow, these are a lot of boxes. What is this?
Sorry, Captain. It's everything Boise asked for.

Fields.MenuText: Why do they all have holes?
There's got to be at least two dozen here!
What's in that big one over there?

Fields.DialogueText: You'd have to ask her, Captain.
I think the total is around twenty-nine.
I'm not sure. I just know it was really heavy.
Hey, Cap, sorry about all this extra stuff. I'm sure I can make room for it.
You want to tell me what you're bringing on my ship? Or do I have to guess?
It'd be no fun if I just told you. Though guessing games aren't any fun either.
Captain, there are Morganas headed this way. They seem to have their eyes on the city.
Well, let's stop them, then. Come on!
You heard her.
@BATTLE
Excuse me, do you know where all those boxes ended up? I've been looking for a while and haven't been able to find them.
Oh, you mean all the crates Boise asked for?
Exactly.
I'm pretty sure she moved them away from the storage room on her own. Just so you wouldn't find them.
That sounds like her. Thanks anyway.
Wait, I'm pretty sure I saw where she hid them.

Fields.MenuText: Really? Where?
Well, spit it out.
That sounds a little too convenient. Is this part of Boise's plan?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't really remember, but I think I can get you a map.
I would, but... It'd be easier to draw you a map or show you.
Well, it's not really convenient. I, uh... I'll just draw you a map.
Wait, why can't you just tell me?
I don't really remember. I might've been a little inebriated. I'm going to need to retrace my steps.
Fine, just get your map to me soon. Right now, I just hope you're not too drunk to fight a few Morganas.
@BATTLE
This is definitely the room. At least... I think it is. It's a good thing he's not our cartographer. We'd never get anywhere.
It's kind of dark in there. I can hardly see anything. I'll just poke my head in.
I think I can just barely see something... yeah those are the boxes. I'm going to need a light though.
Captain, there you are! I've been looking for you. What are you doing down here?

Fields.MenuText: Uh... Nothing...
I was looking for you. Some of the crew pointed me in this direction.
I dropped a penny. Have you seen it anywhere?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Uh-huh, sure.
Well, here I am. What did you need?
A penny? Seriously?
... Uh... why were you looking for me?
We've got Morganas headed for us. Figured you should know before I blow them out of the water.
Well, let's do it, then.
That's the plan. You're the one holding us up!
@BATTLE
*sigh* Why is it so hard to skulk around looking for crates undisturbed?
Hey, Captain. Um... is that a flashlight you've got there?
Your British cousins would call it a torch.
Oh, fancy-schmancy. What, is somebody too good for a lantern?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. This is so much easier than fire light.
You still prefer lanterns?
There's nothing fancy about them. Everyone's using them these days.

Fields.DialogueText: Easier isn't always better.
Yeah, it's way more useful. Plus, fire is comforting.
Well, I don't use them.
Well, you're a Belle. I guess things are different for you.
That sounded insulting.
I didn't mean it that way.
Whatever. That alarm means I've got more important things to fight than you.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I can see perfectly now. There are even more boxes than I remember.
Let's see if I can see inside them.
I can only barely see through this hole.

Fields.MenuText: *Look through one hole while shining the light in another.*
*Just pry it open already.*
Maybe I should give it up.

Fields.DialogueText: I think I can see now. Wait... is that an eye? Whoa! I saw something move!
Okay, enough with this. Where's that crowbar? Hey... is this box making noises?
It might be time to head back. A Morgana could attack any moment now.
*ALARM*
*Animal sounds of all different kinds*
Why is the ship rocking so much!? Ahhh!
*Crash-Crack-Break*
What are these? Squirrels? I gotta get to the deck, we've got Morganas.
What are all these things? They're crawling all over the ship!
Ignore them! We can't allow any distractions in the middle of battle.
Grrrrrr. Captain...
Don't growl at me. Growl at the Morganas!
@BATTLE
The ship is overrun with animals, Captain.
How did they all get out?
We're working under the assumption that the squirrels worked together to free the bigger animals. There are teeth marks on the crates to support this theory.
Great! Look what you did! Are you happy now? All my fun is ruined.

Fields.MenuText: It's not my fault. The squirrels did it!
You're the one who loaded them onto the ship in the first place!
What are you mad about? Isn't this what you wanted?

Fields.DialogueText: That's the oldest line in the book.
I'm also the one that dragged them away so no one else would, I don't know... break them out!
I didn't want to turn the ship into a zoo! I wanted to hunt one crate at a time, safely. Hardly anyone would have noticed.
Well, what are we going to do now?
Now, you let me handle it.
Okay. We'll follow your lead here.
Hehe, does that make me the Captain now?
Don't push it.
Captain, we've got Morganas to the south.
Looks like we'll have to deal with the animals later.
Maybe they'll help us fight the Morganas.
Wouldn't that be something?
@BATTLE
How's the hunt going, Boise?
Eh, it could be going better.
Are you kidding? Captain, I saw Boise capture a couple dozen squirrels with just a single acorn. I've never seen anything like it.
He's full of it. I had two acorns.

Fields.MenuText: That's still very impressive, Boise.
Squirrels, that's it? I think I saw an elephant on my way to the head.
So what's next? We've still got more animals than crew on this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: You ain't seen nothing yet.
If you'd seen an elephant, I'm pretty sure you'd know. Eh, either way, it's going down soon enough.
Patience. I'm just getting started.
*ALARM*
Great.
Oh, sounds fun. I could go for some real battle right about now.
Do you think it would be too cruel to launch a crate full of squirrels at the Morganas?
Seeing as how they would probably die on impact? Yes.
@BATTLE
Captain, I have good news and bad news. Which do you want first?

Fields.MenuText: Give me something good.
Might as well hear the bad first.
Surprise me.

Fields.DialogueText: So, I was able to take down a couple of deer, and we're going to have venison for a few days.
So... I guess someone accidentally picked up an elephant. But, it's just a young one, so it shouldn't destroy the ship or anything.
Well, a few deer were causing some havoc below deck, but I was able to take them down before they did too much damage.
Great... an elephant. You're not going to kill it, right?
I won't. I'm a hunter, not a poacher.
There's a difference?
Poachers hunt and kill anything for profit. Hunters hunt for fun and only kill what they need to.
I understand. I'm glad to hear it, actually. I was a little worried the ship would be covered in the blood of woodland creatures by the end of this.
Nope. Just a little deer blood in the boiler room. It'll come right out.
But we can work on cleaning that after we take care of this alarm.
@BATTLE
Okay. What's the good news?
That was the good news. The bad news is there's a little elephant running around the ship.
That should be good for morale. What's the bad news?
You weren't wrong about seeing an elephant. I guess someone accidentally picked up a young one.
Seriously? So I did see an elephant? What's the good news?
Venison burgers!
*ALARM*
It's still crazy below deck. It's a mess. There are bats! How are there bats?
I'm working on it!

Fields.MenuText: Get it out of my hair, Boise!
Oh, for the love of... somebody get me a blowtorch!
Is it gone?

Fields.DialogueText: It's already gone.
Sheesh, calm down. It's long gone.
Yeah, you're in the clear.
*clears throat* So having some trouble with these bats?
A little. I can't get them to stay still. They've gotta be nesting somewhere. I just can't find them.
Nesting? That's a scary thought.
It has to be somewhere nice and dark...
Maybe the room you were keeping them in? It was pretty dark.
That's a good idea, actually. I haven't even looked there. I figured they'd all run for freedom.
Well, you can look after we deal with a few Morganas.
Yeah, yeah, bring 'em on!
@BATTLE
So, Boise, what are you hunting now?
Actually, I was just about to decide between the ferrets and the bobcats.

Fields.MenuText: Go for the ferrets. The little rodents are everywhere.
I'd say bobcats. They've been scaring the crew lately.
What? I haven't seen either of those anywhere!

Fields.DialogueText: Bobcats, it is. Thanks for helping me decide.
Ferrets, here I come. Thanks for the help deciding.
They're everywhere. You clearly haven't been paying attention.
Well, if you need me, I'll be on the hunt.
Have fun, just try and be careful.
Careful I don't get hurt, or that I don't hurt anyone?
Both.
Well, can I hurt those Morganas?
If I said no, would that stop you?
No, but if you said yes, I might decide not to.
@BATTLE
Boise, I've been wondering for a while... where are you putting all these animals after you catch them?
Well, when I can catch them, I've been putting most of them in my room.
In your room?
Yeah, there's plenty of space.

Fields.MenuText: So, there are tons of squirrels roaming around your room right now?
So, you have a bunch of bats roosting above your bed right now?
So, the elephant is just cuddling in your bed?

Fields.DialogueText: No, of course not. We unloaded them a while ago.
No, we released them. They wanted out. They just couldn't find the exit.
Maybe... he's super cuddly.
Anything I put in my room is just there while we're at sea. When we make landfall, I let them off.
I see. I also hope you're not putting things like bobcats and ferrets together.
... Of course not. ... I'll be right back.
That could be bad.
Captain, we've got Morganas coming this way. Where is Boise going?
She has to deal with something. Don't worry, she'll be ready for the fight.
@BATTLE
Boise, I'm going to need a timetable here.
Is that like a table with a clock in it? That sounds kind of cool.
How much longer is this going to take you?
I'm already done thinking about the clock table. It'd be too hard to eat on it with the second hand always ticking away.
I mean the animals.
Oh! I'm not sure. Maybe a week. At most a month.
That's longer than I was expecting.
Well, if I move any faster, I could miss some.

Fields.MenuText: I understand, but I've got an idea.
Sounds like incompetence. If you don't think you can do it, just say so.
... You'd put the clock in the table with a layer of glass on top.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm open to suggestions.
What? To hell with that! I can do anything. Just you watch! I'll flip the ship over and shake them all out if I have to!
You're still thinking about that? We've moved on, Cap.
Captain, we...
Morganas?
Yeah.
I'm locked and loaded, Cap.
Let's get this done quick so we can get back to what's important.
Um, aren't Morganas important?
Yeah, yeah.
@BATTLE
All right, everyone, listen up!
Yeah, pay attention!

Fields.MenuText: Thanks for the backup, Boise.
I'm talking to you too, Boise.
What are you doing over here? Go stand with them.

Fields.DialogueText: Hehe, I like being loud.
What? Pfft, fine.
What? Grrrrr...
As we all know, there's a bit of an infestation on our ship. It doesn't matter whose fault it is.
*cough* Yours! *cough*
... Boise has been taking her sweet time taking care of them, and it's taking longer than I was hoping.
So, I'm instituting a new system. We're all going to be hunting them now. It's going to be a bit of a competition.
What!?
For every animal you catch, you'll bring it in and be awarded a certain number of points. I believe the scoreboard has been posted in the mess hall.
Yes.
You can exchange your points for certain amenities. Extra food, money, etcetera. It's all on the board.
Are there any rewards for the most points at the end?
Check the board.
Morganas heading our way!
But first, time to take care of a few Morganas.
@BATTLE
What do you think of the board? Good system, right?
It's ridiculous. I had enough trouble before. Now I'm going to have a bunch of amateurs getting in my way.

Fields.MenuText: It sounds more like you're afraid of a little friendly competition.
I guess you have a point, but it's a little late now.
Look, for fifteen points you get an extra meal.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not afraid of anything. And there's nothing friendly about hunting.
Well, I'm not making any promises about the crew's safety. It won't be my fault if they jump in front of an arrow.
And for one point you can get a gumball. Or for a hundred you can get an autographed picture of the Belle of your choosing? Seriously, Captain?
Mark my words, this is going to end horribly.
Whoa, the top prize is "Captain For A Day." Maybe I'll try and catch a few rats!
I'm not sure the rats are part of the competition.
What did he say?!
That's the top prize.
Hehehehehe. Maybe this won't be so bad.
A chill just ran down my spine...
Well, shake it off. I can smell Morganas nearby.
@BATTLE
Not with that attitude.
Yeah, I'm hoping no one makes it there, but I wanted to give the crew some real incentive.
When you say it like that, I get a little worried.
Captain, I thought you might want an update on the contest.
Yeah, sounds good. How's it looking out there?
There's definitely been an effect, but I don't think it's what you were expecting.
That sounds vague and nerve-wracking.

Fields.MenuText: Are there more animals than before? Are they multiplying?
The crew didn't go on a murder rampage did they?
Just give it to me straight.

Fields.DialogueText: No, no... well, maybe, I don't know. But there are definitely less animals on the ship than before.
Of course not, though we do have more meat in our storage than before.
It's really nothing horrible.
The crew is participating somewhat, but the most points accrued has been twenty-three.
That's not that low.
Boise is also participating. She's earned three hundred and one points.
... I... uh... why did I expect anything else?
Captain, I'm sensing a few Morganas. We up for a fight?
Sound the alarm, Officer.
Yes, Captain.
Good, my bow hand has been cramping a little.
You know it's only for a day, right?
A lot can happen in a day.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
What's going on out here?
He got in the way!
What?
It's just a graze, I'm fine.
You don't look fine. You can barely walk.
Stop being a baby, it went right through.

Fields.MenuText: Boise, help me bring him to the infirmary.
How would you like it if I shot you, Boise?
Still, we should bring him to the infirmary, just to be safe.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, I'll grab his legs.
I get it, I get it. Let's get him checked out.
Okay, I'm all about safety or whatever.
I'm fine, seriously. I'll get myself there. That's the alarm, go deal with those Morganas.
Yeah, I...
We'll get you there first. Then we can fight Morganas.
Pfft, fine.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
We're looking good. I haven't seen an animal in quite some time.
Well, you're not looking hard enough. There are still plenty I haven't caught yet.
Like what?
Well, there are porcupines under the bow, a few anteaters are hanging out near the engines, and I'm pretty sure I saw a monkey around the barracks.

Fields.MenuText: We have porcupines?
Anteaters? Does that mean we have ants?
I've always wanted a pet monkey.

Fields.DialogueText: The porcupines are the least of our worries. Just don't try to touch them, they don't like that.
Anteaters don't just eat ants. They could be eating termites or grubs too. Whatever we have, I'm sure they'll take care of them.
You don't want this one. It's got a chip on its shoulder or something. I saw it flinging poo everywhere.
I've noticed that a lot of these animals aren't exactly normal things people hunt.
Well, it wouldn't be any fun to just hunt a bunch of deer or hogs or something. I wanted to try out some exotic stuff.
As if hunting on a ship wasn't enough of a challenge.
Not for me.
How about Morganas? Are those enough of a challenge?
So far? Nope.
@BATTLE
I'm glad to see you're doing better.
Same here. I told you I'd be fine.
Yeah, so did I, but someone just doesn't listen.

Fields.MenuText: Any residual pain?
You want to shoot her to get even?
Ready to get back to work?

Fields.DialogueText: Not really. I'm back at one hundred percent, Captain.
I'm good, but I'll consider it if it happens again.
Can't wait, Captain.
Seriously, I'm sorry about the whole shooting you thing and all that. Didn't mean to, you know?
It's okay, I was getting way too into the whole hunting contest thing. Speaking of, I haven't seen any animals around lately.
Thank you.
Yeah, Boise's been cleaning up. Soon we'll be a human only crew again.
Mostly.
Mostly?
Don't worry about it. I'll talk to you about it later.
*groan* I'd press the issue, but that's the alarm.
Exactly, it's butt kicking time!
What do you think that was about?
If I had to guess? I'd say she wants to keep a pet.
@BATTLE
I'm fine with it. I still want a scar!
*ALARM*
All right, the animals are finally gone! The hunt is over.
*mixed levels of applause*
So let's see how the points turned out. Officer.
So, a lot of you have turned in your points, gotten something in exchange, but I want to let you know that that doesn't affect your total earned.
Get on with it already!
In third place we have Officer Jacobs! And he's earned this lovely portable phonograph.
*applause*
In second place, Seaman Ivanov, who has earned extra meals for the rest of the year.
*ooooooh*
And finally, in first place, we have Boise, with a whopping 443 points.
I shot another rat. So now it's 444.
A whopping 444 points.
So, do I get to be Captain now?

Fields.MenuText: Technically, yes.
Now? Like right now? Let's hold off for a second.
I might have to rethink this.

Fields.DialogueText: Great. But not yet, I want to take full advantage of this.
Maybe I don't wanna. If I did it right now, you couldn't stop me, since I'd be the Captain.
Too late, I already got it.
Captain!
Yes?
We've got Morganas heading towards us.
All right, I'll wait to be Captain. But only because I want to shoot some Morganas.
@BATTLE
Soooo... I think it's time!

Fields.MenuText: Time to get a new watch?
Time for?
Don't tell me. You want to be Captain now?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe if we've worked out all the kinks of the timetable, but no.
Oh, silly, Captain. Do you really need to ask?
Hehehehe, you got it.
It's Captain Boise time! Everybody has to listen to me for the rest of the day!
When you say it like that, it sounds a little evil.
Pfft, I'm not going to abuse it. I'm just going to lead my crew bravely into battle.
So... what's your first order?
Order? Oh, I guess I have to do that, huh... well, how about we go find Morganas! Really tough ones. I want to find some that will really get my blood pumping!
If you're sure, I'll go pass on the word.
Oh, um, before you go... I'm also instituting a new policy.
Policy? What is it?
Um... everyone named Boise gets a pet.
I knew it. What did you keep?
Is that really important? I'm the Captain, now. I don't have to answer you.
I'm just curious.
The elephant...
If you weren't the Captain right now...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, Morganas coming in from the north!
@BATTLE
All right, your day as Captain is done. How was it?
Your job is hard! I hated it. It sucked! How do you do it!?
Yeah, it's not the easiest job in the world.
It's the worst! I... don't make it too much easier, huh?

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean?
You bring excitement. I like it.
You can say that again!

Fields.DialogueText: I mean I'm kind of a handful, aren't I?
You're just saying that. You have to be.
I knew it. I'm a hassle.
I never listen to you. I do whatever I feel like, without any regard for anyone else, and I like making things more difficult.
You listen to me sometimes.
Not enough... I'm sorry. After seeing what it's like from your side, I have a lot more respect for you now.
You really don't have to be sorry. If you were ever any actual trouble, I could easily throw you in the brig or something.
I could materialize out.
You know what I mean. I don't have to be here, but I am. We're... friends, right?
Are we?
We've been through enough that I'm pretty sure that's what we are.
Yeah, you have a point. I guess we are. Thanks a lot for not getting rid of me.
You'd get rid of your elephant before I'd get rid of you.
I'd never get rid of Mrs. Cuddlelumps!
Exactly.
